posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Eldrich Harvester (Fighter 18 / Wizard 6 / PM 16)


Image source: https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/war ... 0916135155



Greetings all!

On the theme of PM builds, I collected this one from the harvest today.

The first goal this grim warrior aims is as much indestructibility as possible. 

With close to 600 base HP, all the combat feats / pre-epic feats you desire, plus crit immunity, sneak immunity, EDR III, 1x Epic Energy Resistance / 3x Resist Energy Feats, EMA / Epic Warding, +11 to saves against spells (ie a fort save of 40 against spells like implosion) I believe this chap is very difficult to kill.

The secondary goal is to do be able to do some damage so it is enjoyable to play solo. Base AB 39 combined with the great defensive power should be enough to go solo with this guy, although more is always desirable. With Str capped (+6 AB), Bless/Aid pots (+2) and a +5 weapon, the AB hits 52. I chose Scythe from a thematic point of view and to do a bit of Str damage when its capped close to 40.

I put improved disarm in the build for situational AB buffs against those pesky rogue types for a further +8 AB against tiny weapon wielders, +4 AB against small weapon wielders, and no penalties against medium weapon wielders. Also if you do actually disarm them, then they probably aren't going to do much damage against you with your EDR III, inability to sneak/crit you, and damage reduction against fire/acid/cold/electricity, not to mention if you have ghostly visage/ethereal visage up and they aren't a monk. 

A level 6 wizard spell book with 36 spells / day plus scribe scroll/craft wand is also handy, you get to wield the flaming scythe of death from level 4 with flame weapon, and sharpen the scythe with Keen edge at level 6! 

Traps are going to be a pain without evasion or a significant disable trap skill, but with the find trap spell, and some points in search I've tried to manage this the best I could. 

He can set some traps too if desired, simply cap dexterity for set trap 15 to set deadly fire/electrical/tangle traps (or cast one with the land from a scroll for +4 if you can - I think wizards can do this with some scrolls).



Image source: https://i.redd.it/ydxxsqc62r831.png


The caster level of 6 is not the best, however its kind of a bonus rather than a necessity to do the task required.  Hence I haven't invested in any metamagic feats.

That being said, with craft wand at level 21, if you get dispelled you can recast your improved invisibility, or haste with ease.

Or make a few Fireball and ILMS wands for a bit of fun against non-spell resistant types.

Add the dwarven beard / dark vision / Cha 6, and this guy will try to impersonate a full plate equipped Grim Reaper the best he can.

Or an unstoppable tractor motoring along with a whirling scythe of death.

Design notes
When preparing this a Fighter 20/Bard 4/PM 16 could get a base AB of 40 with EDR III but I traded the 1 AB, tumble as class skill for the level 6 wizard spell book + craft wand, I thought it would be more fun to play shooting fireballs and ILMS from a wand, crafting lesser spell breach wands or scribing Tensor's Transformation scrolls.

Theres a handful of high fighter/PMs in the archives (ie fighter 16+ PM 15+). Most of them from a long time ago. 

None I could find have EDR III.
Grizzled_Dwarflord has his classic build The Myrmidon Eternal F/B/PM with a base AB of 42, str 34, this is a lovely build. 
Mithdradates posted his Soldier of Death Fighter 20/PM 16/Wizard 4, with dev crit scimitar achieves a base AB of 42, is very nice. 
Faign posted his DeathDozer Fighter 20/Bard 4/PM 16, and Eindride posted his Fighter 20/Bard 4/PM 16.


Image source: https://www.tokkoro.com/picsup/5058916- ... scythe.jpg


Anyway I've put this up for your review and general consumption, hope you enjoy the post, happy to receive any comments.

posts.author: webshaman1

Yeah, I have run this build before (well, much like it).

Magic is it's Achilles heel.

That is why I abandoned it - it is a strong melee build, don't get me wrong.  And I do like the Epic DR and stuff.  But against magic it just gets hammered.  And due to the low caster levels, buffs run out too soon, and get dispelled to easily.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Well, Clerics and Druids also get SR spell, which is not too shabby!
The target creature has its spell resistance set to 12, +1 per caster level. If the target already had a higher spell resistance, this spell has no effect.
52 SR is only going to be beat by a ISR (Improved SR) Monk.

And opposing spellcasters will need some Spell Penetration to lower that 55% effectiveness and/or some Mord's or Nature's Balance (Breaches will do fine!).

The worst spell, is, of course, Bigby's.  Followed by Greater Ruin and tons of IGMS, whatever.  Run into a horde of Drow Wizards + Priests and you will see what I mean.  Then BBoD (ugh, and being in a Hand spell, one cannot run!  Time to pop that Greater Sanc! - not that it is gonna last long).

You will roll a 1 - eventually.

With the right management, the build does pretty well.  Get caught unprepared against the wrong fellows - yikes!

posts.author: Ten Pura
posts.content:
Orion,
I think this build is very well done. One option might be to put off a couple fighter more fighter levels to push Fire Resist from pre-epic to Epic Energy Resistance: Fire at the cost of 1 AB. It would also push Craft Wand up, which is an important feat in this build, but again, that's just an option.

I also thought you might put off Exotic Weapons and Weapon Focus to bump up Blind Fight, but that might just be my personal bias.

Keep a Wand of Lesser Spell Breach handy for mage battles. This build should win more fights against a level 40 Wizard/Sorcerer than it loses.

If you know in advance you're going to fight a mage, prepare Bigby's Forceful Hand. You'll have 5 rounds to strip buffs (if needed) and wreck an arcanist.

The biggest threat to this build is a Zen-Archer with decent Monk levels, not a mage.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content: The problem with a monk is that even if you do counter it, you still cannot kill it.  If you want to counter any zen archer (that is not an arcane archer) you use EDR and Mordekainen's Disjunction.  The monk cannot kill you and you cannot kill the monk.  Who runs out of stored enchantments first :)

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
A divine and magical damage dealing Zen Archer, if the divine/magical damage cannot be dispelled, will basically wreck the Mage.

About the only thing I can think of is

A). Overcoming the SR of the Monk - assuming the Monk in question does not have all ISR feats and only Monk levels (making it immune to magic). Then a Hand spell and perhaps Gr. Sanc combined with either BBoD or a fixed version of empowered Edvaard's Invasive Tentickles.

B). Timestop, followed by ext.Haste, followed by Timestop, followed by Gr Sanc and flee.
